page.title: 04 High Gosforth Park contd.
page.content: Preparations begin months before the races.Three weeks before a race,entry forms are sent out.Entries are confirmed four days before the race, and trainers must make the final declaration of their horses which are running 24 hours before the start. Before a jockey races he has to be weighed.All the jockeys get changed in one room where there is a weighing machine.The jockeys weigh themselves and if they are too light they put on heavier boots or lead weights in the saddles. Then they all go out to be weighed separately.After a race is over the jockeys are weighed again. If they are found to be over weight they could be fined up to 500 pounds. Spectators can watch the races from 3 areas, the Silver Ring, Tattersalls and the Club area.On 12 days of the year,the racing is televised nationwide
